content:
Diagnosis:		Acinar cell carcinoma of pancreas

Management:		12 Jan 2024 Whipple's procedure

Histology:		Acinar cell carcinoma, R0 resection, no lymphovascular invasion. TGFBR2 mutation detected.

Current situation:	Routine surveillance review

[redacted name] attended for routine follow-up today. She has made an excellent recovery following her Whipple's procedure in January. Her post-operative course was uncomplicated and she has now returned to her usual weight of 65kg. Her appetite is good and she is managing a normal diet with pancreatic enzyme replacement. Blood tests show stable liver function and CA19-9 remains within normal range at 12 U/mL. Recent surveillance CT on 15/4/24 shows post-operative changes only with no evidence of recurrence. The plan is to continue 3-monthly surveillance with next CT scan due in July 2024. We will review her again following this scan.

primary_cancer.histopathology_status: acinar cell carcinoma, R0 resection, no lymphovascular invasion

cancer_timeline.value: Whipple's procedure performed with R0 resection
CA19-9 within normal range at 12 U/mL
CT shows post-operative changes only with no evidence of recurrence

patient_facts.value: Managing normal diet with pancreatic enzyme replacement

status_updates.value: Acinar cell carcinoma of pancreas treated with Whipple's procedure. Excellent post-operative recovery with no evidence of recurrence
Returned to usual weight of 65kg with good appetite
